newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Vietnam coffee market stagnant ahead of harvest.
newsitem.headline: Vietnam coffee market stagnant ahead of harvest.

text.p: Vietnam's coffee market was at a near standstill this week as traders awaited the start of the 1996/97 (Oct-Sept) harvest.
"There's no stock available right now," said one trader. "So there's no business, no real prices."
Traders said buyers were bidding around $1,300 per tonne FOB Saigon Port and sellers were looking for up to $1,450.
They estimated remaining stocks of coffee at no more than 3,000 tonnes.
The new crop is expected to be ready for harvesting early next month.
